summary: The New York City Subway is a huge train system in New York City, with 472 stations. It opened in 1904 and runs 24/7. It's one of the oldest, busiest, and longest subway systems globally, carrying over 2 billion riders in 2023. The system has 28 routes, and most go through Manhattan. Some tracks are elevated, and others are at ground level. Express and local trains share many lines, with express trains using the inner tracks. The subway is funded by fares, taxes, and government money.
title: New York City Subway
